comment.text: Enjoyed our time. Food was very well done. Grouper dish was much lighter than expected.  Could have qualified as a small plate.  Girlfriend got the salmon...much better value on the dollar.  Lively spot.  Good location. Very good mixed drink.  Solid to nice meet-up spot.

An overall awesome option for lunch, brunch, or dinner in the Va-Hi area. Food is innovative and tasty, ambiance is laid back, and service is top notch. Ask for Amy if you are coming in, she is very thoughtful and courteous. Everything is delicious and combinations are well thought out by the cook staff. Most main dishes come with a bright salad as a side which is great to contrast some of the heavier dishes. 

Most haves: the Korean Queso and Guacamole dips - crispy wonton chips were delicious to scoop both of these
Crispy potatoes - these are topped with Parmesan, parsley, and some green onions
Frittata - you will get a made-to-order personal frittata as opposed to a slice of an already cooked one. The added Boursin cheese made it super fluffy and soft. Note: it comes with the side salad on top because it is best eaten together but feel free to get it on the side too

photos.caption: Side salad with fried Chicken burrito

comment.text:
When Whiskey Bird first opened, we lived down the street and honestly thought it was good, but not great. When Morningside Kitchen closed, we tried it again and were much more impressed.

Then we went for brunch. Oh my. Their fried chicken bubble waffle is just plain spectacular, with the right hints of spiciness to balance out the sweetness. It's so good that we've tried in vain to find a substitute now that we live in Chicago, a surprise because Chicago has so many amazing restaurants. We had occasion to be back in Atlanta recently, and not to put too fine a point on it the spots we made it a priority to hit were Bacchanalia and Lazy Betty for dinner - and Whiskey Bird for brunch.  Fortunately Whiskey Bird did not disappoint. Hopefully Michelin covers them for their next guide update. I think they deserve a Bib Gourmand personally, at least for brunch.

This place is incredible. Just chill vibes, very friendly and kind staff, unique fusion flavors. Highly recommend for brunch on the weekend. We had the golden chai, Brussel sprouts, fried chicken breakfast burrito, and bao Benedict. Of all these, the Brussels are a MUST. Also, don't skip out on the golden chai if you're looking for a drink of Fall. 

Request Mia S. Kind and fun human with honest feedback and direction on the dishes!

Liked *  Liked *  Liked * Liked * Liked * Liked * 

Peruvian Chicken Tacos: So yummy we ordered more than one round! 

Popcorn Chicken: Sauces were yummy, the chicken was crispy, and I even used some of the sauces on the cabbage that the chicken sat on to make a tasty "salad". We did wish there were a couple more pieces of the chicken though..

Tuna Tataki: So yummy, with a slight spice. This tuna was very flavorful and the sauces were a great compliment to everything. The seaweed salad was delicious too. 

The food was so tasty.

Autumn in New York Drink 


Disliked ^ Disliked ^  Disliked ^ Disliked ^ Disliked ^
 
The parking seems like it can be a little challenging.

Whiskey Bird is a fun, modern restaurant  serving new American fare with Asian influence!

As a group of 6, we ordered two apps for the table -- no small plates here! We had the roasted cauliflower which was smothered in gouda fondue, a dish which can obviously do no wrong. My one criticism was that it was a bit hard to divide and conquer without getting super messy. 

We also shared the brussels sprouts, which as other reviewers mentioned are a must. Not too sweet, extra crispy, and lots of umami from the bonito flakes! They served the bacon on the side to accommodate a vegetarian in our group, which was appreciated.

For my main, I ordered the bourbon glazed grilled salmon which came on top a sweet potato hash with miso caramelized onions, chinese broccoli, and chinese sausages. The salmon was fine but the sausages were crispy little bombs of flavor -- totally unexpected! 

Lastly, we got the hummingbird cake for dessert as a recommendation from the waiter. It's their signature dessert. I liked it but wouldn't get it again -- I personally didn't think it was that great? But I'm also not big on pecans?

Whiskey Bird is reliably good, which makes it a great choice for a date night or parents visiting! They've got a big patio, a trendy (but not pretentious!) open-concept indoor space, and excellent service that makes you feel welcomed! I would recommend :)

We always enjoy going to Whiskey Bird, and we just tried out their brunch. It was pretty busy, so we were glad that we grabbed a reservation.

The service was great. Our server was very friendly and helpful, especially when we were being annoying and couldn't figure out what we wanted to eat and drink. LOL.

For food, we decided on the Crispy Brussels, Bao Benedict, and both the chicken & tuna Gyoza Tacos. OMG the brussels are a must-order. They might be some of the best ones that I have ever tried, and the fried egg on top was just *chef's kiss*. My friend and I each switched out one of our tacos so that we got to sample both, and surprisingly, I preferred the chicken taco over tuna. The Bao Benedict was good, though it was probably my least favorite out of the options that we tried. We love Bloody Marys and prefer tequila... so their Bloody Maria with jalapeno infused tequila was right up my alley. It was good, not too spicy, and I enjoyed the seasoned salt rim.

It's a great spot in Virginia Highlands, and I'm sure we will be back soon.

Popped in early on a Friday night.   What a score!!  Got a seat outside and we had a couple of appetizers and then mains.   The roasted cauliflower in fondue was rich and delish.   The chicken gyoza tacos were crunchy, juicy and I could have eaten three orders.   So good.    My wife got a messy double patty burger and was in heaven.   I had the Thai Noodle Steak Salad.  It was good but not close to any of our other tastes.    

Service was on point and I want to come back to try more!

I've always heard great things about whiskey bird and it didn't not disappoint! Love the ambience and they also have a patio. 

My favorites were the tuna salad and crispy Brussels sprouts. I love they added the bonito flakes and egg with the Brussels sprouts. The salad was so fresh and with the seared ahi tuna, it was an amazing brunch dish! Their menu offers a variety of fusion food which I appreciate.

We came into Whiskey bird this past Sunday hoping we would be able to get a seat.  It was the brunch hour which it seems they are known for, and the reservation system showed booked.  We took our chances and popped in anyhow.
they had a breakfast bar to sit at with FCFS seating so we were glad to grab two spots. It was actually a great spot with big morning windows along side us and a server right there with a ready and a sunny disposition.  
She had waters over to us quickly and a few good tips on what to order too.  I got their eggs benedict per her recommendation and my gal got their breakfast burrito.
Both were pretty good.  I wasn't a fan of the Benedict but I appreciated what they did with it, original.
Meanwhile the ambiance and service was excellent.  Being from out of town, it really was enjoyable to see how nice the people of ATL were.  
There's good chance we will be back soon.

Finally made it to this spot! It's been on my list for years believe it or not. Myself and a few friends had brunch here on a Sunday. Parking was great as there's a lot across the street. We made reservations online and was immediately seated. We ordered a few different entrees and appetizers with my favorite being the potatoes and Brussels!! The potatoes and Brussels were everything!!! The chicken with the chicken and waffles was a lil under seasoned but the waffle was cute and had good flavor, kind of thin. The steak was also a little under seasoned but was juicy and tender. 
-1 star for lack of seasoning on entrees and -1 star for mimosas. 

The frose was good and had a kick to it. The mimosas was rather dark but the tequila cocktail was strong as well. 

Our server was super friendly and I'm glad I finally made it. Not sure if I'll be back. If I do, it'll be for the Brussel and potatoes and to try other appetizers.
Great service with a fun menu and wonderful Japanese whiskeys. I love to pop in here during the week for dinner.

This is one of the best gyms in Atlanta... The salmon was absolutely spectacular Savannah... Cooked to perfection and seasoned and over a bit of sweet potatoes and sausage. I've never had better. The salads and burgers and tacos are incredible. The service was awesome. Our server took such good care of us and treated us with extra hospitality and made the experience so pleasant. The ambience is casual, but very nice and slightly upscale but not stuffy...and just fresh. One of the top five Keylime pies that I've ever eaten... This place is awesome 
Madison was incredible

Came in for the cocktails and might say they where absolutely amazing! This restaurant caters to its customers and what makes them happy. It's so often times a restaurant will make it difficult to substitute or to change things but this restaurant lets you have things your way! These server's beautiful smile and enthusiasm lightened up our spirit and kept us feeling, cozy and catered. The lovely setting was draped in lights, open windows and greenery. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because the food menu was so limited I felt like there was nothing filling to get.

photos.caption: Spicy Mexico City & Sloe gin fizz

comment.text: Incredibly good food and service. The brussels are the best I have ever had hands down. Everything was excellent.

photos.caption: Crispy Brussels + Ahi Tuna Gyoza Tacos

comment.text:
This place is a gem in Atlanta. 

The whiskey drinks were exceptional - no surprise based on the name. 

Food was unique and delicious. Make sure to opt for the starters and treat yourself to the whole array to really get a sense of all the flavors and options. 

Paris was an exceptional server. She really had a great way with making suggestions for the group based on their preferences and not just recommending what she likes the most. It was impressive how thoughtful and attentive she was.

Whiskey Bird has been on my list for a while, and after seeing that their patio is dog-friendly, we decided to stop in for dinner on a Sunday. 

The patio is the perfect place to sit outside with your dog. It is fairly enclosed and safe from the elements. They had fans going, and I believe they have heaters during the winter. We checked in with the hostess at the front, and she had us walk around to the backside to meet her on the patio.

We happened to stop by at happy hour which is on Sundays and Tuesday-Thursdays from 5-6:30pm. They have discounted drinks and bites, which was nice. We tried the following items, and enjoyed them all:

- Okonomiyaki fries 
- gyoza tacos with peruvian chicken, salsa verde, cotjia cheese (comes with 2 small tacos)
- popcorn chicken with WB & Korean bbq dipping sauces
- WB chopped salad 

My husband ordered the Bourbon-spiked Arnold Palmer, and I had the frose and the special frozen drink, which was a lavender Paloma. My favorite was the latter!

I went to Whiskey Bird for brunch with a friend and I'm so glad we decided to try it. Service was standard. The food was hot and flavorful. The vibes were upbeat from the moment we walked in with the music and restaurant decor. I had the WB Breakfast Sandwich and would definitely order it again.

My biggest gripe is we made a reservation specifically during happy hour, but when we arrived it was the end of happy hour and could only order one round before it ended. Update your website! It's not that hard. Took a picture with updated happy hour times and days - so much more affordable during happy hour. That being said, everything we had was delicious - the tuna tacos are in a hard shell - just something to keep in mind. Margarita delicious, Japanese fries tasty, and seared tuna also delicious. I'll be back for happy hour!

photos.caption: Updated happy hour menu with accurate hours unlike their website

comment.text: The food and drinks here are amazing. So much flavor and balanced out perfectly in each dish we had. The chicken sliders on the bao bun were exceptionally fantastic. Possibly the best chicken sandwich I've had. The service was standout too. Everyone was very friendly and personable.

Came on a Saturday afternoon w/ my friend for an early dinner! I enjoyed the atmosphere and food, plus the service was super fast and responsive. If you can, ask for (Weston? His name starts with a W, lol) but he was great! Made great recommendations based on our likes/dislikes and was extremely attentive & prompt. 

Parking:
You are able to parallel park right outside of the restaurant and my friend said they have their own lot, but the way I came and my lack of parallel parking skills resulted in me parking in the lot right across the street which was free of charge and had plenty of space! So, if you come and there are spots open over there I recommend doing that as well! 

Atmosphere:
Walking in, it was pretty empty but the seats at the bar were just about full. Seems like they had a good system going as far as to-go orders and I saw quite a few people coming to pick-up at their pick-up window. With it being pretty empty inside, the interior looked a little more like industrial than expected like with exposed roof piping in some areas but white/modern looking in others.. it definitely has cute character to it. The outside patio area was the star of the show for us with the small tables, brown benches, and wicker decorations. It was a hot day, but it was definitely shaded and controlled enough where we weren't hot or uncomfortable while dining which was a plus. 

Vibes:
Very good place for intimate conversation with friends, a date, or even a business meeting. I don't recall hearing any background music, but if there was any it was VERY subtle. Do know this place is honestly very casual, the table next to us waiting on their to-go order brought their adorable dog with them (PETS ALLOWED, THEY BROUGHT THE DOG A BOTTLE OF WATER). 

Drinks:
Both my friend and I ordered Rose 75. It had a very strong taste of grapefruit and stayed carbonated for quite a long time. I'm not the biggest fan of citrus drinks and prefer my drinks very sweet, so this was just eh to me. I'm not a huge fan of brown but it seemed as though their more interesting drinks included whiskey or bourbon so plenty to choose from if that's your speed! 

Food:
For an appetizer we had the Crispy Brussels and they were a 10/10 for me! My friend and I were both a little weary of the inclusion of the egg, but our waiter was right in telling us to mix it in. The Brussels were truly crispy, there was enough bacon, sauce, etc.. I want to drive back over there right now just thinking about them  Definitely the highlight of the night for me! I'd also like to try the gyoza tacos! 

For an entree I had the tuna poke bowl. I forgot to ask them to hold the edamame since I'm not a fan, but the other ingredients were very refreshing and played well together. The bowl even included sliced radish, which I never had and found to be a nice touch! Can't remember the sauce they provided but it was very salty like a soy sauce and if you have any knowledge of sushi or sauces I am definitely an eel/teriyaki sauce sort of girl so I wish there was more of a sweet element or sweet sauce provided with the dish! 

We didn't order dessert but they did give us complimentary strawberry Pocky sticks after we closed out our bill! Super cute touch. 

Price: 
Everything is MORE than reasonably priced for the portion size! I had SO much food left-over that I wish I could've taken with me if I was going straight home! 

All in all, I'd go back and recommend it to those who enjoy Asian-fusion! You can find a visual recap of my dining experience @toast2atl!

We had the best Brunch at Whiskey Bird today.  The food was delicious I highly recommend the Brussels and Burger and the cocktails were delicious.  Our server Leah was awesome and the best part is they are dog friendly on the patio and our Dog Beau had the best time. We will definitely be back for more dog friendly, delicious brunches.

Erin

The avocado toast was actually pretty good! Also ordered the cauliflower appetizer which was just ok, probably wouldn't get it again. But overall I would be back! They had some unique menu items and plenty of vegetarian options. Also the inside was really cute as well! I could see this being a cute date spot or just somewhere to grab lunch with a friend! Also Very quick service and they do accept reservations. As for parking, there is plenty of street parking!

JUST WOW! The food was amazing, and the outdoor seating was to die for! My burrito was one of the best I've ever had, and the service was amazing! If your looking for a nice restaurant, this is the place!

If you're looking for light eats this is the place to go! Very healthy eating options and I feel like this embodied the true definition of Asian Fusion.

To start I ordered the rose 75 to drink. This was very good and refreshing. Tasted like wine and grapefruit which I didn't mind. My friend however wasn't too big of a fan of this. I asked for the sweetest drink and our waitress suggested this. 

We also ordered the Brussels sprouts which I was nervous about, I've had bad experiences with Brussels sprouts but this was sooo good. The toppings really pulled everything together--especially the bacon and the sunny side up egg. I would definitely order this again.

I ordered the ahi tuna and this wasn't my favorite meal, but it was good. It is very vegetable heavy so it's probably good for my vegetarian/pescatarian option. It was a little dry and I let our waiter know and he brought back some WB sauce which helped alot so I'd suggest the same!

Overall I'd come back again. I'd like to try their brunch!

This place is such a vibe! There is a front patio (I believe a back patio as well), it has an open concept kitchen, and it's immediately inviting. There is easily accessible (free) street parking around the front and back, which is a huge perk. We were able to come around happy hour on a Friday without a res and were seated quickly. Our server, Maya, was INCREDIBLE. She was so fun, had the best reccs, and we really just wanted to be her friend irl (sadly she's no longer there!). They usually have two frozen drink options - frosé and a special -- I got the creamsicle. It was so yummy with a good balance of orange and vanilla and very strong, made with vodka, 10/10. We got a few apps and meal to share (5 people). Apps we tried: crispy Brussels (perfectly crispy, savory with a little sweet, 9/10) and the dip duo (fresh guac, Korean queso, and wonton chips, YUM 8/10). The Thai steak and noodle salad was refreshing with so many fresh flavors, perfectly cooked medium rare steak, and pops of fresh mint leaves, 9/10! The bourbon glazed salmon was not too sweet, cooked well, moist, and flaky, complimented well with the sweet potatoes and sausage which had plenty of sauce, 8/10. The seared ahi tuna was also yummy, but had only a few pieces of ahi tuna (I believe 5, as we each got a small piece), served with what I believe was a seaweed salad, very well flavored, 7/10. 

Overall, I was so impressed with this place and will absolutely be back. Perfect girls night, happy hour, hang out spot!
We went for brunch! Really good portions. Brussel sprouts were good as well as this salad. I'd go back and try another entree!

Unassuming outdoors but cool looking insider located in a nice neighborhood. After a 3 hour drive to Atlanta it was a godsend to start with their Bloody Mary. I have to say it can compete with the ones I had in NOLA. Delicious! Appetizers were delicious and we enjoyed them a lot. I probably didn't need the Bao Benedict's. But my hubby was hungry so he ordered the steak burrito too. Both entrees were large servings we had them to go. The service was friendly and fast. Price - not cheap but not too expensive either.

photos.caption: Bao Benedict's - it could have been better if the bao was properly baked. The sauce was also bland.
Ahí tuna tacos - its seasonings made it atypical but delicious tacos.
The restaurant is located in a quiet neighborhood ready for the holidays!
Bloody Mary! One of the best I've had.
Brussel sprouts with caramelized onions and shiitake mushrooms - an egg on top of any dish reminds me of a typical Korean dish.
Steak tacos. My hubby liked it. I didn't. Too bland for me.

comment.text: I love love this spot! Someone introduced me to this spot (have a nice outdoor covered patio), been going regularly! Need to go back ASAP! I normally order the poke bowl with seared tuna , filled with avocado, pickles, rice, tuna, edamame , mango, radish and plethora of good healthy ingredients! I order the Lavender and Paloma gin- tonic some o delicious. Happy hour is Tuesday through Thursday and Sunday, I have tried the fish tacos and Okonomiyaki fries during happy hours delicious! Prices are great during happy hour and prices are affordable during regular hours. Parking is behind the restaurant or you can park across the street for freeeeee! Will be back soon!

photos.caption: Poke bowl with seared tuna (avocado, mango, edamame, rice, carrots, pickles and other veggies! Sooooooooooooo good! My favvvvvvvv

comment.text: Great service and delicious chicken and waffles! I was stopping to grab breakfast here with a friendly while visiting and glad we did. The service was also great - very friendly and attentive. There is limited street parking however there is a lot across the street.

Enjoyed a lovely dinner at Whiskey Bird on a Tuesday night. The restaurant was busy so I recommend making reservations. We enjoyed a bottle of Tempranillo($44), gimlet($14), tuna to start, and shared the crispy tofu and salmon. Everything was delicious.
is amazing and has become one of my favorite places in Atlanta. The hummingbird cake is out of this world.

photos.caption: There isn't a bad thing on the menu. Get it all. Especially the hummingbird cake

comment.text:
I absolutely love this place.

Every time I've been here, the service has been really great. A few times we had bigger parties and the staff was very accommodating and kind to our group. 

I've also tried every single appetiser and drink on their happy hour menu - they never frickin disappoint!!! 

10/10 would recommend this place :)

Brought my mom here for her birthday and we were hooked. I'm a girl who loves Brussel sprouts and when I saw that they had brussels sprouts on the menu I was ecstatic. The brussels sprouts are roasted and have a thin slither of tuna flakes scattered on the top with a fried egg. It doesn't get any better than that. I also ordered the crispy grouper and it was also delicious.

I have gone to Whiskey Bird for weekend brunch as well as weekday happy hour menu. The brunch was reasonably priced and refreshing. The food I got at happy hour was also delicious, and I definitely felt full when I left. The bartender was very nice to me, as this was my first time going to happy hour and sitting at the bar. The restaurant as a whole is very clean, and the indoor and outdoor seating options are comfortable.

Maya was the best server ever!!! My friend and I came in after a long night and she treated us so well (bringing us lemon & salt for our water without asking, continually checking on us). Food was amazing. Started with chips & guac/queso. We were expecting the average order of chips & guac but these were AMAZING. The wonton chips were unique but so flavorful, in addition to the queso and guac. Seasoned so well. I got vegetarian breakfast burrito and my friend got the bao benedict. Both were amazing. Portions were large, had to take to-go boxes. 

Were seated on outdoor porch but it was screened in and had heat lamps. Very comfortable. 

This is my third time at Whiskey Bird and I'll be back for sure!!!

Came for a Friday night dinner, overall this lands as a low 4 star for me, right on the edge of if I'd come back or just enjoy it as a one time try.

Food is the big one, they had some unique offerings and overall it was quality. 
The whole cauliflower is a sight to see! It's cooked and seasoned well, the only caution is it is a hefty portion, we ended up with about a quarter left splitting it between 4.

The chicken sandwich app was the clear winner for me, I ordered a second as a savory dessert. The chicken is crispy and juicy, the bun though is the unique spin which makes it. Would suggest getting a side of the spicy Korean bbq and dipping!

Tacos were ok, true shell was crunchy and unique though the chicken in the middle was a bit more of a mush like slow cooker chicken. Flavor was ok.

The crispy rice bites were nice though very small for the price.

Stuck rice in any of the dishes was great and the poke bowl was fresh and flavorful. 

The skewers were fun and quite a variety, the main knock here would be the sauces seemed to blend together and not highlight the meat or veggie enough.

The space was ok, we sat on the patio and had a space for 4 tucked back in a corner. Service was also just ok, potentially a new person but wasn't what I'd look for in a 5 star stop.

I was a bit disappointed in Whiskey Bird because they had such great reviews. I was expecting my taste palette to be wowed. It was for the appetizers. Both the chicken gyoza tacos and tuna gyoza tacos were so good that we ordered them again. The flavor was to die for and the tacos were full. The sliders were just as good and again, our table ordered another.

However things went downhill when the entrees came. The chicken burrito was okay, but lacked flavor. The steak and eggs were dreadful. The steak was over cooked and the eggs had the weirdest texture ever. We couldn't tell if they were mashed potatoes or potato salad when they first came out. The taste was so mushy and the eggs were unseasoned. The chicken and waffles were okay, but nothing to rave about. If seemed like the overall consensus was a lack of flavor, so maybe they were just having an off day. Even though the appetizers were bomb, I don't think I would come back here

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Saida,
Thank you so much for dining with us, and I am happy to hear you enjoyed all your appetizers!  I am sorry to hear you did not enjoy your entrees as much.  I have shared your feedback with our culinary team so they can review and address it.  Please always feel free to provide feedback to your server during your meal so we can resolve things in the moment.  Thank you again for dining with us and for your feedback!

comment.text:
Came here on a Tuesday afternoon for drinks and appetizers. It wasn't too busy and we were seated outside (our preference) very quickly. There is parking in the back also. 

I ordered the frosé and it was tasty but strong. We ordered the dip duo and ahi tuna tacos as the appetizers. The dip duo had amazing queso and it was definitely the preference. The wonton chips with it were a great pairing. The guac was also good but next to the queso it didn't compare. The ahi tuna tacos were also so tasty. It comes with two in a serving but I did think one is pretty filling.

The ambiance of the restaurant is great especially outside during nice weather. Definitely recommend.
Fantastic service and food! Their food is unique and fresh. Asian fusion done in the best way possible!
I LOVE Whiskey Bird's brunch. Truly 10/10. Great cocktails and choice of foods. If you're looking for great brunch you have to come here!!

Great place for Asian fusion. Service is on point. You have to get the fried chicken baos, everything in the bao complements one another. I love that they do wonton chips for their dips instead of tortilla. Also nice brunch prices considering the area.

photos.caption: Moscow mule, chicken bao, and dip duo

comment.text:
Our server was fantastic! She was very attentive and helpful. 

The decor is gorgeous. The blue-green color palette made me feel calm and happy. 

If you want to make a reservation Whiskey Bird is on Resy, but we got here at 5:30 on a Wednesday and we're immediately seated. 

I began my evening with a rose 75. It has pink gin, fresh grapefruit, and bubbles.  My next drink was a Manhattan which is on their regular cocktail menu. I really appreciate that the cocktail menu has a picture of the glassware the drink will be served in next to the cocktails ingredients. 

My first course was the tuna tataki and it was on the happy hour menu in January 2022. It melted in my mouth. I was being Ketoish so I had the Caesar salad for my meal. I loved the pickled jalapeños. 

I will be back as there are so many items on all of their menus I want to taste.

photos.caption: Rose 75 cocktail!! Pink gin, fresh grapefruit, and bubbly

comment.text:
I found this spot while browsing Yelp for a new restaurant to try. I noticed that they offer a Happy Hour Tuesday - Thursday and Sunday from 5-6:30pm. A few friends and I opted to check out Whisky Bird at 5pm for Happy Hour on a Wednesday. I was able to make reservations in the morning for 5pm for a table for 3. 

I arrived a few minutes prior to 5pm and I was able to parallel park directly in front of the restaurant-- SCORE!!  Upon walking in we were immediately seated at a booth. I do believe we were the first patrons for the night. 

Our waitress was so friendly and  was very familiar with the menu. She offered detailed descriptions of drinks and food. She also made sure the our water glasses were always full. She  was engaging, courteous, service oriented. And simply put- AMAZING! 

I ordered the Okonomoiyaki fries and the tuna tataki. One of my friends ordered a cocktail and the katsu Sando, and my other friend ordered the chicken tacos off the happy hour menu and an entree salad. I also ordered a dessert ( a brûlée that was a special for the night) . When I tell you that each of us enjoyed every bite of our food. Everything was cooked fresh and had an amazing taste! I am already trying to plan my next visit so that I can try other menu items. 

In addition to this place having good food and service, the decor is cute! It's a nice place for a cute Instagram photo! Last, but not least, each of us were given a complimentary small pack of Pocky chocolate! SCORE again! 

Go ahead- make that reservation, or just stop in if you are in the neighborhood!

photos.caption: Katsu Sando- a chicken sandwich on steroids- yes, it's that good
The Japanese style fries- a must try! These are amazing!

comment.text:
Fun brunch spot. I enjoyed the eggs Benedict and a mimosa. Bao Benedict
If you're in ATL I definitely recommend taking advantage of this yummy spot.

We had an amazing time at Whiskey Bird for brunch on New Years Day. We were able to easily make reservations online from the website the night before. They have indoor and outdoor seating available. The outdoor seating was spacious and there were heat lamps available although we didn't need that because it was 70 degrees. 

Paris was our server and she was bomb! Like one of the best servers I've had in a long time. She was extremely detailed and attentive. When we arrived, she detailed every drink on the brunch menu and made them all sound so delicious. It was impossible to say no. I ended up with a drink that wasn't on the menu, the Gingerbread frozen. It was yummy and was just the right amount of boozy. Others in the group got the frose and the rose 75. And everyone had great things to say.

Let's get into this food! We had the brussel sprouts and chip duo to start. Brussel sprouts are a must! Amazing flavor and delicious. The dip duo was good and I love some wonton chips. For entree I got the crispy grouper sandwich. It was a 10/10. Perfectly fried and seasoned and the coleslaw on the sandwich was also good. Others in the group got the chicken and waffles and four egg frittata. My bro said the chicken and waffles were aight. Nothing major to write home about. You typically think of chicken and waffles as a heavy dish and they make theirs with bubble waffles so it turns out to be really light. My sis loved the egg frittata. 

Also scooped up a key lime pie for my dad and he loved it. Said it was the best he's had in awhile. I can't wait to return and try more dishes. Paris said they have good happy hour and dinner menus too!
We had a great meal. Staff were very polite and helpful. Drinks were delicious!  Food was great!
Maddy is the best bartender in Georgia. The smile, the service, the drinks. Great hire!

Before coming I read a review that mentioned that the appetizers were better than the entrees & I paid attention. After searching for a brunch destination I was perturbed at most restaurants menus & prices. I have to mention that this place is extremely moderately priced imho. We were seated on the front patio out of the sun with a gorgeous breeze. Our drinks, a whiskey sour & mimosa were average at best but we throughly enjoyed our food. The dip duo was served with both guac & a cheese sauce with house made chips. Our second choice were the crispy Brussels which were indeed delicious. It's worth noting that the sizes of these appetizers are humongous. My wife & I were extremely full after those alone yet we decided to try the gyoza tacos with chicken which were ok & indeed small.

I had dinner here with my friend on a Thursday evening around 7 PM & the crowd was light. Our waitress was very attentive and friendly and kept checking in with us. We had the Peruvian chicken tacos which was absolutely delicious, so good we ordered it twice and I didn't even get a picture of any of the meal. I also got the salmon as my main even though I almost full off the appetizers alone. Highly recommend and will be back.
